00054 /*****************************************************************************\
00055  * NOTICE OF CONVENTION                                                      *
00056  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- *
00057  * Mspec links to Pcode, Hcode, and Lcode modules.  In order to allow this   *
00058  * to take place without requiring front-end modules to link to liblcode.a,  *
00059  * Mspec code is divided into two classes as follows:                        *
00060  *  - mi_*.c must not depend on linkage to liblcode.a                        *
00061  *  - ml_*.c may depend on linkage to liblcode.a                             *
00062 \*****************************************************************************/
00063 
00064 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00065 #include <config.h>

00068 #include <machine/m_hppa.h>
00069 #include <machine/m_impact.h>
00070 #include <machine/m_hpl_pd.h>
00071 #include <machine/m_sparc.h>
00072 #include <machine/m_x86.h>
00073 #include <machine/m_ti.h>
00074 #include <machine/m_sh.h>
00075 #include <machine/m_bx86.h>
00076 #include <machine/m_tahoe.h>
00077 #include <machine/m_starcore.h>
00078 #include <machine/m_arm.h>
00079 #include <machine/m_wims.h>
00080 #define MD_DEBUG_MACROS         /* Use type-checking versions of md.h macros */
00081 #include <library/md.h>

00083 /*
00084  *      Global variables
00085  */
00086 int M_arch = 0;
00087 int M_model = 0;
00088 int M_swarch = 0;
00089 
00090 int Mspec_num_int_caller_reg = 0;
00091 int Mspec_num_int_callee_reg = 0;
00092 int Mspec_num_flt_caller_reg = 0;
00093 int Mspec_num_flt_callee_reg = 0;
00094 int Mspec_num_dbl_caller_reg = 0;
00095 int Mspec_num_dbl_callee_reg = 0;
00096 int Mspec_num_prd_caller_reg = 0;
00097 int Mspec_num_prd_callee_reg = 0;
00098 
00099 void
00100 M_read_parm (Parm_Parse_Info * ppi)
00101 {
00102   L_read_parm_i (ppi, "num_int_caller_reg", &Mspec_num_int_caller_reg);
00103   L_read_parm_i (ppi, "num_int_callee_reg", &Mspec_num_int_callee_reg);
00104   L_read_parm_i (ppi, "num_flt_caller_reg", &Mspec_num_flt_caller_reg);
00105   L_read_parm_i (ppi, "num_flt_callee_reg", &Mspec_num_flt_callee_reg);
00106   L_read_parm_i (ppi, "num_dbl_caller_reg", &Mspec_num_dbl_caller_reg);
00107   L_read_parm_i (ppi, "num_dbl_callee_reg", &Mspec_num_dbl_callee_reg);
00108   L_read_parm_i (ppi, "num_prd_caller_reg", &Mspec_num_prd_caller_reg);
00109   L_read_parm_i (ppi, "num_prd_callee_reg", &Mspec_num_prd_callee_reg);
00110   L_read_parm_s (ppi, "layout_database_name", &M_layout_database_name);
00111 }
00112 
00113  
00114 /* New portability model reads much of Mspec information from a file
00115  * generated using a C program built using application structure information,
00116  * etc., and compiled with the host compiler.  
00117  * May want to make M_type_database_name a parameter in some modules later.
00118  * Initially, IMPACT/Lcode is the only arch/model to use this functionality.
00119  * -ITI/JCG 2/99
00120  */
00121 int M_use_layout_database = 0;
00122 char *M_layout_database_name = "./host_layout_info.md";
00123 
00124 /* Used only by M_read_database_i() and M_read_database_s() */
00125 static MD *M_layout_database = NULL;
00126 
00127 void
00128 M_assert (int cc, char *mesg)
00129 {
00130   if (!cc)
00131     {
00132       I_punt ("m_spec: %s\n", mesg);
00133     }
00134 }
00135 
00136 void
00137 M_set_machine (char *arch, char *model, char *swarch)
00138 {
00139   /* IMPACT/Lcode is the new public (portable) arch/model, 
00140    * All the other arch/model combinations are being phased out.  -JCG 2/99
00141    */
00142   if (!strcasecmp (arch, "impact"))
00143     {
00144       M_arch = M_IMPACT;
00145       M_set_model_impact (model);
00146     }
00147   /* Renamed playdoh to HPL-PD, accept variations. -JCG 7/14/98 */
00148   else if ((strcasecmp (arch, "HPL-PD") == 0) ||
00149            (strcasecmp (arch, "HPL_PD") == 0) ||
00150            (strcasecmp (arch, "playdoh") == 0))
00151     {
00152       M_arch = M_PLAYDOH;
00153       M_set_model_playdoh (model);
00154     }
00155   else if (!strcasecmp (arch, "hppa"))
00156     {
00157       M_arch = M_HPPA;
00158       M_set_model_hppa (model);
00159     }
00160 #ifndef IMPACT_EXTERNAL
00161   else if (!strcasecmp (arch, "sparc"))
00162     {
00163       M_arch = M_SPARC;
00164       M_set_model_sparc (model);
00165     }
00166 
00167   else if (!strcasecmp (arch, "x86"))
00168     {
00169       M_arch = M_X86;
00170       M_set_model_x86 (model);
00171     }
00172   else if (!strcasecmp (arch, "ti"))
00173     {
00174       M_arch = M_TI;
00175       M_set_model_ti (model);
00176     }
00177   else if (!strcasecmp (arch, "sh"))
00178     {
00179       M_arch = M_SH;
00180       M_set_model_sh (model);
00181     }
00182   else if (!strcasecmp (arch, "bx86"))
00183     {
00184       M_arch = M_BX86;
00185       M_set_model_bx86 (model);
00186     }
00187   else if (!strcasecmp (arch, "tahoe"))
00188     {
00189       M_arch = M_TAHOE;
00190       M_set_model_tahoe (model);
00191       M_set_swarch_tahoe (swarch);
00192     }
00193   else if (!strcasecmp (arch, "starcore"))
00194     {
00195       M_arch = M_STARCORE;
00196       M_set_model_starcore (model);
00197     }
00198 #endif
00199   else if (!strcasecmp (arch, "arm"))
00200     {
00201       M_arch = M_ARM;
00202       M_set_model_arm (model);
00203     }
00204   else if (!strcasecmp (arch, "wims") || !strcasecmp(arch, "wims_gen1"))
00205     {
00206       M_arch = M_WIMS;
00207       M_set_model_wims (model);
00208     }
00209   else
00210     {
00211       fprintf (stderr, "[%s]\n", arch);
00212       M_assert (0, "unknown M_arch");
00213     }
00214 }
00215 
00216 /*
00217  *      The following functions are for documentation only.
00218  *      The function overhead is too great for actual usage.
00219  */
00220 void
00221 M_char (M_Type type, int unsign)
00222 {
00223   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI/JCG 2/99 */
00224   if (M_use_layout_database)
00225     {
00226       type->type = M_TYPE_CHAR;
00227       type->unsign = (unsign != 0);
00228       type->align = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "char", "align");
00229       type->size = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "char", "size");
00230       type->nbits = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "char", "size");
00231     }
00232   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00233   else
00234     {
00235       switch (M_arch)
00236         {
00237         case M_IMPACT:
00238           M_impact_char (type, unsign);
00239           break;
00240         case M_TAHOE:
00241           M_tahoe_char (type, unsign);
00242           break;
00243         case M_SPARC:
00244           M_sparc_char (type, unsign);
00245           break;
00246         case M_HPPA:
00247           M_hppa_char (type, unsign);
00248           break;
00249         case M_X86:
00250           M_x86_char (type, unsign);
00251           break;
00252         case M_PLAYDOH:
00253           M_playdoh_char (type, unsign);
00254           break;
00255         case M_TI:
00256           M_ti_char (type, unsign);
00257           break;
00258         case M_SH:
00259           M_sh_char (type, unsign);
00260           break;
00261         case M_BX86:
00262           M_bx86_char (type, unsign);
00263           break;
00264         case M_STARCORE:
00265           M_starcore_char (type, unsign);
00266           break;
00267         case M_ARM:
00268           M_arm_char (type, unsign);
00269           break;
00270         case M_WIMS:
00271           M_wims_char (type, unsign);
00272           break;
00273         default:
00274           M_assert (0, "illegal M_arch type");
00275         }
00276     }
00277   type->flags = 0;
00278 }
00279 
00280 void
00281 M_short (M_Type type, int unsign)
00282 {
00283   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI/JCG 2/99 */
00284   if (M_use_layout_database)
00285     {
00286       type->type = M_TYPE_SHORT;
00287       type->unsign = (unsign != 0);
00288       type->align = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "short", "align");
00289       type->size = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "short", "size");
00290       type->nbits = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "short", "size");
00291     }
00292   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00293   else
00294     {
00295       switch (M_arch)
00296         {
00297         case M_IMPACT:
00298           M_impact_short (type, unsign);
00299           break;
00300         case M_TAHOE:
00301           M_tahoe_short (type, unsign);
00302           break;
00303         case M_SPARC:
00304           M_sparc_short (type, unsign);
00305           break;
00306         case M_HPPA:
00307           M_hppa_short (type, unsign);
00308           break;
00309         case M_X86:
00310           M_x86_short (type, unsign);
00311           break;
00312         case M_PLAYDOH:
00313           M_playdoh_short (type, unsign);
00314           break;
00315         case M_TI:
00316           M_ti_short (type, unsign);
00317           break;
00318         case M_SH:
00319           M_sh_short (type, unsign);
00320           break;
00321         case M_BX86:
00322           M_bx86_short (type, unsign);
00323           break;
00324         case M_STARCORE:
00325           M_starcore_short (type, unsign);
00326           break;
00327         case M_ARM:
00328           M_arm_short (type, unsign);
00329           break;
00330         case M_WIMS:
00331           M_wims_short (type, unsign);
00332           break;
00333         default:
00334           M_assert (0, "illegal M_arch type");
00335         }
00336     }
00337   type->flags = 0;
00338 }

00340 void
00341 M_int (M_Type type, int unsign)
00342 {
00343   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI/JCG 2/99 */
00344   if (M_use_layout_database)
00345     {
00346       type->type = M_TYPE_INT;
00347       type->unsign = (unsign != 0);
00348       type->align = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "int", "align");
00349       type->size = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "int", "size");
00350       type->nbits = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "int", "size");
00351     }
00352   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00353   else
00354     {
00355       switch (M_arch)
00356         {
00357         case M_IMPACT:
00358           M_impact_int (type, unsign);
00359           break;
00360         case M_TAHOE:
00361           M_tahoe_int (type, unsign);
00362           break;
00363         case M_SPARC:
00364           M_sparc_int (type, unsign);
00365           break;
00366         case M_HPPA:
00367           M_hppa_int (type, unsign);
00368           break;
00369         case M_X86:
00370           M_x86_int (type, unsign);
00371           break;
00372         case M_PLAYDOH:
00373           M_playdoh_int (type, unsign);
00374           break;
00375         case M_TI:
00376           M_ti_int (type, unsign);
00377           break;
00378         case M_SH:
00379           M_sh_int (type, unsign);
00380           break;
00381         case M_BX86:
00382           M_bx86_int (type, unsign);
00383           break;
00384         case M_STARCORE:
00385           M_starcore_int (type, unsign);
00386           break;
00387         case M_ARM:
00388           M_arm_int (type, unsign);
00389           break;
00390         case M_WIMS:
00391           M_wims_int (type, unsign);
00392           break;
00393         default:
00394           M_assert (0, "illegal M_arch type");
00395         }
00396     }
00397   type->flags = 0;
00398 }

00400 void
00401 M_long (M_Type type, int unsign)
00402 {
00403   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI/JCG 2/99 */
00404   if (M_use_layout_database)
00405     {
00406       type->type = M_TYPE_LONG;
00407       type->unsign = (unsign != 0);
00408       type->align = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "long", "align");
00409       type->size = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "long", "size");
00410       type->nbits = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "long", "size");
00411     }
00412   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00413   else
00414     {
00415       switch (M_arch)
00416         {
00417         case M_IMPACT:
00418           M_impact_long (type, unsign);
00419           break;
00420         case M_TAHOE:
00421           M_tahoe_long (type, unsign);
00422           break;
00423         case M_SPARC:
00424           M_sparc_long (type, unsign);
00425           break;
00426         case M_HPPA:
00427           M_hppa_long (type, unsign);
00428           break;
00429         case M_X86:
00430           M_x86_long (type, unsign);
00431           break;
00432         case M_PLAYDOH:
00433           M_playdoh_long (type, unsign);
00434           break;
00435         case M_TI:
00436           M_ti_long (type, unsign);
00437           break;
00438         case M_SH:
00439           M_sh_long (type, unsign);
00440           break;
00441         case M_BX86:
00442           M_bx86_long (type, unsign);
00443           break;
00444         case M_STARCORE:
00445           M_starcore_long (type, unsign);
00446           break;
00447         case M_ARM:
00448           M_arm_long (type, unsign);
00449           break;
00450         case M_WIMS:
00451           M_wims_long (type, unsign);
00452           break;
00453         default:
00454           M_assert (0, "illegal M_arch type");
00455         }
00456     }
00457   type->flags = 0;
00458 }

00460 void
00461 M_llong (M_Type type, int unsign)
00462 {
00463   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI/JCG 2/99 */
00464   if (M_use_layout_database)
00465     {
00466       type->type = M_TYPE_LLONG;
00467       type->unsign = (unsign != 0);
00468       type->align = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "longlong",
00469                                        "align");
00470       type->size = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "longlong", "size");
00471       type->nbits = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "longlong", "size");
00472     }
00473   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00474   else
00475     {
00476       switch (M_arch)
00477         {
00478         case M_TAHOE:
00479           M_tahoe_llong (type, unsign);
00480           break;
00481         case M_PLAYDOH:
00482           M_playdoh_llong(type, unsign);
00483           break;
00484         case M_ARM:
00485           M_arm_llong(type, unsign);
00486           break;
00487         case M_WIMS:
00488           M_wims_llong(type, unsign);
00489           break;
00490         case M_IMPACT:
00491         case M_SPARC:
00492         case M_HPPA:
00493         case M_X86:
00494         case M_TI:
00495         case M_SH:
00496         case M_BX86:
00497         case M_STARCORE:
00498         default:
00499           M_assert (0, "illegal M_arch type");
00500         }
00501     }
00502   type->flags = 0;
00503 }
00504 
00505 int
00506 M_type_size (int mtype)
00507 {
00508   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00509   if (M_use_layout_database)
00510     {
00511       switch (mtype)
00512         {
00513         case M_TYPE_VOID:
00514           return 0;             /* No database read necessary, 
00515                                    IMPACT convention */
00516         case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00517         case M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT:  /* ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00518         case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00519           return 1;             /* No database read necessary, 
00520                                    IMPACT convention */
00521         case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00522           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "char", "size");
00523         case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00524           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "short", "size");
00525         case M_TYPE_INT:
00526           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "int", "size");
00527         case M_TYPE_LONG:
00528           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "long", "size");
00529         case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00530           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "longlong", "size");
00531         case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00532           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "float", "size");
00533         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00534           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "double", "size");
00535         case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00536           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "void *", "size");
00537         case M_TYPE_UNION:
00538         case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00539         case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00540           return -1;            /* No database read necessary, 
00541                                    IMPACT convention */
00542         default:
00543           return -1;
00544         }
00545     }
00546   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00547   else
00548     {
00549       switch (M_arch)
00550         {
00551         case M_IMPACT:
00552           return M_impact_type_size (mtype);
00553         case M_TAHOE:
00554           return M_tahoe_type_size (mtype);
00555         case M_SPARC:
00556           return M_sparc_type_size (mtype);
00557         case M_HPPA:
00558           return M_hppa_type_size (mtype);
00559         case M_X86:
00560           return M_x86_type_size (mtype);
00561         case M_PLAYDOH:
00562           return M_playdoh_type_size (mtype);
00563         case M_TI:
00564           return M_ti_type_size (mtype);
00565         case M_SH:
00566           return M_sh_type_size (mtype);
00567         case M_STARCORE:
00568           return M_starcore_type_size (mtype);
00569         case M_ARM:
00570           return M_arm_type_size (mtype);
00571         case M_WIMS:
00572           return M_wims_type_size (mtype);
00573         default:
00574           M_assert (0, "illegal M_arch type");
00575           return -1;
00576         }
00577     }
00578 }
00579 
00580 int
00581 M_type_align (int mtype)
00582 {
00583   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00584   if (M_use_layout_database)
00585     {
00586       switch (mtype)
00587         {
00588         case M_TYPE_VOID:
00589           return -1;            /* No database read necessary, 
00590                                    IMPACT convention */
00591         case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00592         case M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT:  /* ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00593         case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00594           return 1;             /* No database read necessary, 
00595                                    IMPACT convention */
00596         case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00597           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "char", "align");
00598         case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00599           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "short", "align");
00600         case M_TYPE_INT:
00601           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "int", "align");
00602         case M_TYPE_LONG:
00603           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "long", "align");
00604         case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00605           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "longlong", "align");
00606         case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00607           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "float", "align");
00608         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00609           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "double", "align");
00610         case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00611           return M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "void *", "align");
00612         case M_TYPE_UNION:
00613         case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00614         case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00615           return -1;            /* No database read necessary, 
00616                                    IMPACT convention */
00617         default:
00618           return -1;
00619         }
00620     }
00621   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00622   else
00623     {
00624       switch (M_arch)
00625         {
00626         case M_IMPACT:
00627           return M_impact_type_align (mtype);
00628         case M_TAHOE:
00629           return M_tahoe_type_align (mtype);
00630         case M_SPARC:
00631           return M_sparc_type_align (mtype);
00632         case M_HPPA:
00633           return M_hppa_type_align (mtype);
00634         case M_X86:
00635           return M_x86_type_align (mtype);
00636         case M_PLAYDOH:
00637           return M_playdoh_type_align (mtype);
00638         case M_TI:
00639           return M_ti_type_align (mtype);
00640         case M_SH:
00641           return M_sh_type_align (mtype);
00642         case M_STARCORE:
00643           return M_starcore_type_align (mtype);
00644         case M_ARM:
00645           return M_arm_type_align (mtype);
00646         case M_WIMS:
00647           return M_wims_type_align (mtype);
00648         default:
00649           M_assert (0, "illegal M_arch type");
00650           return -1;
00651         }
00652     }
00653 }
00654 
00655 int
00656 M_layout_order (void)
00657 {
00658   /* This may not need a database query (for now) -ITI/JCG 2/99 */
00659   switch (M_arch)
00660     {
00661     case M_IMPACT:
00662       return M_impact_layout_order ();
00663     case M_TAHOE:
00664       return M_tahoe_layout_order ();
00665     case M_SPARC:
00666       return M_sparc_layout_order ();
00667     case M_HPPA:
00668       return M_hppa_layout_order ();
00669     case M_X86:
00670       return M_x86_layout_order ();
00671     case M_PLAYDOH:
00672       return M_playdoh_layout_order ();
00673     case M_TI:
00674       return M_ti_layout_order ();
00675     case M_SH:
00676       return M_sh_layout_order ();
00677     case M_BX86:
00678       return M_bx86_layout_order ();
00679     case M_STARCORE:
00680       return M_starcore_layout_order ();
00681     case M_ARM:
00682       return M_arm_layout_order ();
00683     case M_WIMS:
00684       return M_wims_layout_order();
00685     default:
00686       M_assert (0, "illegal M_arch type");
00687       return -1;
00688     }
00689 }
00690 
00691 /* Returns the description of the layout_database.  String returned must
00692  * not be modified, freed, etc.
00693  */
00694 char *
00695 M_layout_database_desc ()
00696 {
00697   char *desc;
00698   MD_Section *section;
00699   MD_Entry *entry;
00700 
00701   if (M_layout_database == NULL)
00702     return ("(Layout database not loaded!)");
00703 
00704   /* Find description of this database (if present).
00705    * Passed as the first entry name in the _HT__info section.
00706    */
00707   desc = "(no description present)";
00708   if ((section = MD_find_section (M_layout_database, "_HT__info")) != NULL)
00709     {
00710       entry = MD_first_entry (section);
00711       if (entry != NULL)
00712         desc = entry->name;
00713     }
00714 
00715   return (desc);
00716 }
00717 
00718 /* Reads and returns the integer field at the given section_name, entry_name, 
00719  * and field_name given in the layout_database.  Punts on any error. 
00720  * -ITI/JCG 2/99
00721  */
00722 int
00723 M_read_database_i (char *section_name, char *entry_name, char *field_name)
00724 {
00725   FILE *in;
00726   char *temp_name;
00727   MD_Section *section;
00728   MD_Entry *entry;
00729   MD_Field_Decl *field_decl;
00730   MD_Field *field;
00731   int value;
00732 
00733   /* Open and read in layout database on first query */
00734   if (M_layout_database == NULL)
00735     {
00736       /* Get the md file */
00737       if ((in = fopen (M_layout_database_name, "r")) == NULL)
00738         {
00739           I_punt ("\n"
00740                   "M_read_database_i: Unable to open '%s' for reading!\n"
00741                   "Query: Value of %s->%s->%s",
00742                   M_layout_database_name, section_name, entry_name,
00743                   field_name);
00744         }
00745 
00746       /* Read in the layout database */
00747       M_layout_database = MD_read_md (in, M_layout_database_name);
00748 
00749       /* Done with file, close it */
00750       fclose (in);
00751     }
00752 
00753   /* Give troubleshooting message if section not found */
00754   if ((section = MD_find_section (M_layout_database, section_name)) == NULL)
00755     {
00756       I_punt ("\n"
00757               "M_read_database_i: Section '%s' not found in '%s'!\n"
00758               "\n"
00759               "  Database built for: %s\n"
00760               "\n"
00761               "  Troubleshooting tips:\n"
00762               "    1) Verify that *ALL* the source was run through "
00763               "gen_CtoP at the same time!\n"
00764               "    2) Verify that %s was generated for this benchmark,\n"
00765               "       platform, and compiler!\n",
00766               section_name, M_layout_database->name,
00767               M_layout_database_desc (), M_layout_database->name);
00768     }
00769 
00770 
00771   /* Find field declaration in section */
00772   if ((field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (section, field_name)) == NULL)
00773     {
00774       I_punt ("M_read_database_i: Field decl for '%s' not found in %s->%s!",
00775               field_name, M_layout_database->name, section_name);
00776     }
00777 
00778   /* Find entry in section, strip off quotes if present */
00779   if (entry_name[0] == '"')
00780     {
00781       /* Make copy of entry name so we can delete last quote */
00782       temp_name = strdup (&entry_name[1]);
00783       temp_name[strlen (temp_name) - 1] = 0;
00784       if ((entry = MD_find_entry (section, temp_name)) == NULL)
00785         {
00786           I_punt ("M_read_database_i: Entry '%s' not found in %s->%s!",
00787                   temp_name, M_layout_database->name, section_name);
00788         }
00789       free (temp_name);
00790     }
00791   /* Otherwise, use raw entry name */
00792   else
00793     {
00794       if ((entry = MD_find_entry (section, entry_name)) == NULL)
00795         {
00796           I_punt ("M_read_database_i: Entry '%s' not found in %s->%s!",
00797                   entry_name, M_layout_database->name, section_name);
00798         }
00799     }
00800 
00801   /* Make sure field present for this entry */
00802   if ((field = MD_find_field (entry, field_decl)) == NULL)
00803     {
00804       I_punt ("M_read_database_i: Field '%s' not found in %s->%s->%s!",
00805               field_name, M_layout_database->name, section_name, entry_name);
00806     }
00807 
00808   /* Get the first element of the field */
00809   value = MD_get_int (field, 0);
00810 
00811   /* Return the value */
00812   return (value);
00813 }
00814 
00815 /* Reads and returns the string field at the given section_name, entry_name, 
00816  * and field_name given in the layout_database.  Punts on any error. 
00817  * Note: Do not modify or free the returned string! -ITI/JCG 3/99
00818  */
00819 char *
00820 M_read_database_s (char *section_name, char *entry_name, char *field_name)
00821 {
00822   FILE *in;
00823   char *temp_name;
00824   MD_Section *section;
00825   MD_Entry *entry;
00826   MD_Field_Decl *field_decl;
00827   MD_Field *field;
00828   char *value;
00829 
00830   /* Open and read in layout database on first query */
00831   if (M_layout_database == NULL)
00832     {
00833       /* Get the md file */
00834       if ((in = fopen (M_layout_database_name, "r")) == NULL)
00835         {
00836           I_punt ("\n"
00837                   "M_read_database_s: Unable to open '%s' for reading!\n"
00838                   "Query: Value of %s->%s->%s",
00839                   M_layout_database_name, section_name, entry_name,
00840                   field_name);
00841         }
00842 
00843       /* Read in the layout database */
00844       M_layout_database = MD_read_md (in, M_layout_database_name);
00845 
00846       /* Done with file, close it */
00847       fclose (in);
00848     }
00849 
00850   /* Give troubleshooting message if section not found */
00851   if ((section = MD_find_section (M_layout_database, section_name)) == NULL)
00852     {
00853       I_punt ("\n"
00854               "M_read_database_s: Section '%s' not found in '%s'!\n"
00855               "\n"
00856               "  Database built for: %s\n"
00857               "\n"
00858               "  Troubleshooting tips:\n"
00859               "    1) Verify that *ALL* the source was run through "
00860               "gen_CtoP at the same time!\n"
00861               "    2) Verify that %s was generated for this benchmark,\n"
00862               "       platform, and compiler!\n",
00863               section_name, M_layout_database->name,
00864               M_layout_database_desc (), M_layout_database->name);
00865     }
00866 
00867 
00868   /* Find field declaration in section */
00869   if ((field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (section, field_name)) == NULL)
00870     {
00871       I_punt ("M_read_database_s: Field decl for '%s' not found in %s->%s!",
00872               field_name, M_layout_database->name, section_name);
00873     }
00874 
00875   /* Find entry in section, strip off quotes if present */
00876   if (entry_name[0] == '"')
00877     {
00878       /* Make copy of entry name so we can delete last quote */
00879       temp_name = strdup (&entry_name[1]);
00880       temp_name[strlen (temp_name) - 1] = 0;
00881       if ((entry = MD_find_entry (section, temp_name)) == NULL)
00882         {
00883           I_punt ("M_read_database_s: Entry '%s' not found in %s->%s!",
00884                   temp_name, M_layout_database->name, section_name);
00885         }
00886       free (temp_name);
00887     }
00888   /* Otherwise, use raw entry name */
00889   else
00890     {
00891       if ((entry = MD_find_entry (section, entry_name)) == NULL)
00892         {
00893           I_punt ("M_read_database_s: Entry '%s' not found in %s->%s!",
00894                   entry_name, M_layout_database->name, section_name);
00895         }
00896     }
00897 
00898   /* Make sure field present for this entry */
00899   if ((field = MD_find_field (entry, field_decl)) == NULL)
00900     {
00901       I_punt ("M_read_database_s: Field '%s' not found in %s->%s->%s!",
00902               field_name, M_layout_database->name, section_name, entry_name);
00903     }
00904 
00905   /* Get the first element of the field */
00906   value = MD_get_string (field, 0);
00907 
00908   /* Return the value */
00909   return (value);
00910 }
00911 
00912 /* Returns 1 if request info is present in the database, otherwise 
00913  * returns 0.  Will punt if database itself is not readable/present.
00914  * -ITI/JCG 2/99
00915  */
00916 int
00917 M_database_info_present (char *section_name, char *entry_name,
00918                          char *field_name)
00919 {
00920   FILE *in;
00921   char *temp_name;
00922   MD_Section *section;
00923   MD_Entry *entry;
00924   MD_Field_Decl *field_decl;
00925   MD_Field *field;
00926 
00927   /* Open and read in layout database on first query */
00928   if (M_layout_database == NULL)
00929     {
00930       /* Get the md file */
00931       if ((in = fopen (M_layout_database_name, "r")) == NULL)
00932         {
00933           I_punt ("\n"
00934                   "M_database_info_present: Unable to open '%s' for reading!\n"
00935                   "Query: Value of %s->%s->%s",
00936                   M_layout_database_name, section_name, entry_name,
00937                   field_name);
00938         }
00939 
00940       /* Read in the layout database */
00941       M_layout_database = MD_read_md (in, M_layout_database_name);
00942 
00943       /* Done with file, close it */
00944       fclose (in);
00945     }
00946 
00947   /* Find section name */
00948   if ((section = MD_find_section (M_layout_database, section_name)) == NULL)
00949     return (0);
00950 
00951 
00952   /* Find field declaration in section */
00953   if ((field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (section, field_name)) == NULL)
00954     return (0);
00955 
00956   /* Find entry in section, strip off quotes if present */
00957   if (entry_name[0] == '"')
00958     {
00959       /* Make copy of entry name so we can delete last quote */
00960       temp_name = strdup (&entry_name[1]);
00961       temp_name[strlen (temp_name) - 1] = 0;
00962       entry = MD_find_entry (section, temp_name);
00963       free (temp_name);
00964     }
00965   /* Otherwise, use raw entry name */
00966   else
00967     {
00968       entry = MD_find_entry (section, entry_name);
00969     }
00970   if (entry == NULL)
00971     return (0);
00972 
00973   /* Find entry in section */
00974   if ((entry = MD_find_entry (section, entry_name)) == NULL)
00975     return (0);
00976 
00977   /* Make sure field present for this entry */
00978   if ((field = MD_find_field (entry, field_decl)) != NULL)
00979     return (0);
00980 
00981   /* Assume if got here, that the info should be present (which is
00982    * what this routine is designed to detect.
00983    * M_read_database_i/s() will punt if something is truely wrong.
00984    */
00985   return (1);
00986 }
00987 
00988 int
00989 M_supports_long_long (void)
00990 {
00991   switch (M_arch)
00992     {
00993     case M_TAHOE:
00994     case M_PLAYDOH:
00995     case M_ARM:
00996     case M_WIMS:
00997       return 1;
00998     default:
00999       return 0;
01000     }
01001 }
01002 
01003 int
01004 M_pointer_size (void)
01005 {
01006   switch (M_arch)
01007     {
01008     case M_TAHOE:
01009       return 8;
01010     default:
01011       return 4;
01012     }
01013 }
